block.p: Nathalie Brochu, the daughter of Jose and Pierre Brochu of Quebec City, was married yesterday to Archibald McGhee Foster III, the son of Diana Worth Foster of New York and Mr. Foster Jr. of Wilmington, N.C. Diane Messier, a civil marriage officiant, performed the ceremony at Domaine Cataraqui, a historic house in Sillery, Quebec.

The bride, 27, is a vice president and research analyst in the media and entertainment group at Merrill Lynch in New York. She graduated from St. Michael's College in Colchester, Vt., and received a master's degree in economics and an M.B.A. from the State University at Buffalo. Her parents work at Financiere Banque Nationale in Ste.-Foy, Quebec, her father as a stockbroker and financial planner and her mother as the manager for life insurance and annuities.

Nathalie Brochu, the daughter of Jose and Pierre Brochu of Quebec City, was married yesterday to Archibald McGhee Foster III, the son of Diana Worth Foster of New York and Mr. Foster Jr. of Wilmington, N.C. Diane Messier, a civil marriage officiant, performed the ceremony at Domaine Cataraqui, a historic house in Sillery, Quebec.

The bride, 27, is a vice president and research analyst in the media and entertainment group at Merrill Lynch in New York. She graduated from St. Michael's College in Colchester, Vt., and received a master's degree in economics and an M.B.A. from the State University at Buffalo. Her parents work at Financiere Banque Nationale in Ste.-Foy, Quebec, her father as a stockbroker and financial planner and her mother as the manager for life insurance and annuities.

The bridegroom, 29, is a vice president and equity strategist at Salomon Smith Barney in New York. He graduated from the University of Richmond. His mother is the assistant director of development at the Japan Society in New York. His father retired as a managing director at Schroder & Company, an investment bank in New York. The bridegroom is the stepson of Pietra Willis Foster.
